definition: policy/plan/scheme/bamboo slip for writing (old)/to whip (a horse)/to encourage/riding crop with sharp spines (old)/essay written for the imperial examinations (old)/upward horizontal stroke in calligraphy
Three Alls Policy (kill all, burn all, loot all), Japanese policy in China during WWII
ostrich policy (sticking one's head in the sand, failing to acknowledge danger)

pinyin: yi1 ge4 Zhong1 guo2 zheng4 ce4

definition: The higher ups have policies while the lower downs have their own ways of getting around them. (idiom)
pinyin: shang4 you3 zheng4 ce4 , xia4 you3 dui4 ce4
du2 sheng1 zi3 nu:3 zheng4 ce4

sentences.english: Under government policy, British nuclear submarines carry a maximum of 48 warheads.
sentences.chinese: 据政府政策规定，英国核潜艇最多可装载48颗弹头。

sentences.english: Either you believe in freedom and middle class trade policies or you dont.
sentences.chinese: 不管你信不信自由和中产阶级贸易政策。

sentences.english: It is also a fundamental tool for the rule laying down policy and law .
sentences.chinese: 它是统治者制定政策与法律的立脚点。

sentences.english: China is implementing a family planning policy. So I'm the only child in my family.
sentences.chinese: 中国正在实施计划生育政策，所以我是家中的独生子。

sentences.english: Farmers are revolting over a new sliding-scale increase in export taxes.
sentences.chinese: 农场主对新出台的出口税率浮动上调政策非常不满。

sentences.english: The institute called the policy “a resounding success.
sentences.chinese: 卡托研究所称这个政策是“一场彻底的胜利。”

sentences.english: Bearing and rearing better children is an important part of the birth control policy of our country.
sentences.chinese: 优育是我国计划生育政策的一个重要内容。

sentences.english: These policies will affect non-whites especially.
sentences.chinese: 这些政策对非白种人的影响特别大。

sentences.english: The new policy on food price will hurt the interest of people on low incomes.
sentences.chinese: 新的食品价格政策将伤害到低收入人群的利益。

sentences.english: His policy of overseas contacts was generally followed by his successors in Ming Dyn …
sentences.chinese: 明朝后代基本上沿用了太祖的海外交往政策。

sentences.english: Second, the professional study team of scientific and technological policy has not formed.
sentences.chinese: 二是科技政策研究没有形成专业队伍。

sentences.english: The rebellion was started by some malcontents who had been dissatisfied with the policy.
sentences.chinese: 造反源于那些对于政策不满的人。

sentences.english: It also covers in detail state appellate decisions construing the policy provisions.
sentences.chinese: 还包括详细的解释政策条款的州上诉决议。

sentences.english: This policy brief is an attempt to put concerns relating to potential allergenicity into perspective.
sentences.chinese: 本篇政策摘要将透视对潜在过敏性的担忧。

sentences.english: Mancheng County's investment policy preferences, relaxed environment.
sentences.chinese: 满城县的招商引资政策优惠，环境宽松。

definition: to officially launch (a policy, program etc)/to appear on stage/to appear publicly/(of a bar girl) to leave with a client
new policy/New Deal (Roosevelt's 1933 policy to deal with the Great Depression)
to put into effect/to carry out
major policy of the national government
to implement/to carry out/to put into practice
